data.title: Meggitt Polymers & Composites Uses RFID to Track Aircraft Components, Materials
data.meta_description:
The company's San Diego plant is employing a GlobeRanger RFID- and sensor-based solution to track the work-in-progress of engine components, and plans to use the system to automate mold press settings.
Sep 16, 2016—

Meggitt Polymers & Composites (MPC)'s manufacturing plant in San Diego is taking the next
data.text:
The company’s San Diego plant is employing a GlobeRanger RFID- and sensor-based solution to track the work-in-progress of engine components, and plans to use the system to automate mold press settings.

—

Meggitt Polymers & Composites (MPC)’s manufacturing plant in San Diego is taking the next step in a radio frequency identification and Internet of Things implementation that employs sensor and RFID data to gain visibility into the company’s work-in-progress (WIP) and the condition of the carbon-fiber composite materials it uses during manufacturing.
